Course Section Definition Public Notes:
Delivery Mode -This is an in-person course. Students are expected to meet in-person on the days and times listed. All courses labelled as ‘in-person’ are fully in-person for the entire term, including exams, and require in-person attendance to complete.

Waitlist Policy -All waitlists will follow a first come, first serve policy, unless specified otherwise. Once a course is full, its status will be changed to “Waitlist” and students who register will be automatically added to the waitlist.

Delivery Mode -This is a mixed online course, it includes both synchronous and asynchronous components. Students are expected to meet online using Zoom on the days and times listed, or else to watch the recorded Zoom lectures each week, as well as complete supplemental asynchronous work outside of class time. All classees will be recorded. Please refer to the course syllabus for details on the asynchronous elements of this course. All courses labelled as ‘online’ are fully online for the entire term, including exams, and do NOT require any in-person attendance to complete.

Waitlist Policy -All waitlists will follow a first come, first serve policy, unless specified otherwise. Once a course is full, its status will be changed to “Waitlist” and students who register will be automatically added to the waitlist.

Delivery Mode -This is an in-person course. Students are expected to meet in-person on the days and times listed. All courses labelled as ‘in-person’ are fully in-person for the entire term, including exams, and require in-person attendance to complete.

Waitlist Policy -All waitlists will follow a first come, first serve policy, unless specified otherwise. Once a course is full, its status will be changed to “Waitlist” and students who register will be automatically added to the waitlist.

Delivery Mode -This is a synchronous hybrid course. Students are expected to meet on the days and times listed, either in-person or online based on the schedule set by the instructor. All courses labelled as ‘hybrid’ have a mixture of mandatory in-person and online activities as designed by the instructor. While some components are online, in-person attendance IS required to complete the course.

Waitlist Policy-All waitlists will follow a first come, first serve policy, unless specified otherwise. Once a course is full, its status will be changed to “Waitlist” and students who register will be automatically added to the waitlist.

Delivery Mode -This is an in-person course. Students are expected to meet in-person on the days and times listed. All courses labelled as ‘in-person’ are fully in-person for the entire term, including exams, and require in-person attendance to complete.

Waitlist Policy -All waitlists will follow a first come, first serve policy, unless specified otherwise. Once a course is full, its status will be changed to “Waitlist” and students who register will be automatically added to the waitlist.

Course Section: ASTU_V 399-201 - Special Topics: Place and Power
Course Section Definition Public Notes:
Special Topic: Indigenous Stories of Hydro Power in Quebec and BC
Explore how Indigenous writers, filmmakers and artists in Quebec and BC engage with the impact of resource extraction on their lands. Study a wide variety of storytelling mediums used by Indigenous artists.  
·        See the full course overview: https://fhis.ubc.ca/course-description/ASTU399   

·        Contact us here: https://fhis.ubc.ca/undergraduate-advising-contact-form/ 

·        Language of instruction: English  

This course meets the Place and Power requirement.

Course Section: ATSC_V 301-201 - Atmospheric Radiation and Remote Sensing

Course Section Definition Public Notes: ATSC 313 is a hybrid, asynchronous course for all students.  All course content is available directly on the course website or through links to outside resources. There is no textbook for this course. All Quizzes and Assignments are open over a set number of days for students to complete when it fits best within their own schedule. These are then submitted online, through the Course Website. There are no lectures to attend or video lectures to follow. The only time students need to attend a session in-person is for the written final exam. The final exam will be written during the UBC exam period, at a time and date arranged by UBC Exam Services. All students will attend the final exam in-person in a UBC classroom.

Please note: Tutorial sessions for BIOC 302 are OPTIONAL. Section T53: Mon 3-4pm, online; Section T57: Tues 10-11am, online; T58: Wed 2:30-3:30pm, SWNG 121;

For those who think they have met the pre-reqs but having troubles with registering into BIOC 302, please contact Dr. Eden Fussner-Dupas eden.fussner@ubc.ca.
please select this option if other tutorial sessions can't fit your schedule.

Multiples sections: 
Students may only register for one required course activity per lecture/lab/discussion or waitlist if there is no space available. Students will be removed from the waitlist if they already have a spot in a section of the course. For example, students may not register for BIOL121 section 121 and also be on the waitlist for section 122. BEING ON THE WAITLIST DOES NOT GUARANTEE YOU A SPACE IN THE COURSE.
